pr_title: fix obfuscating client secret when config is empty

fields.summary: Remove obfuscation of password when google configuration of a customer during onboarding is empty/default

status.description: Issue is waiting to be validated by QA and/or PM
status.name: In QA Validation

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Currently the client secret within Google Config is obfuscated. Which is misleading while onboarding the client onto Google. 

Change the expected behavior to have the client secret have a blank string when the config is empty

Tech caveat:
Currently the default config is picked from APPDIRECT marketplace. One possible solution is to ignore copying of the client id and client secret from the config of Appdirect


HOW TO TEST:
Step 1. Make sure you have no pre-exisiting configuration. Either start with a new marketplace or run the following two queries
i) delete from google_reseller_configs where partner = 'APPDIRECT';
ii) Select * from custom_integration_channel_configs where partner = "APPDIRECT" and custom_integration = "GOOGLE_APPS";

Step 2. Use a rest client ie Postman to get the config. endpoint= '/api/channel/v1/custom/integration/configurations/GOOGLE_APPS'

Step 3. Verify that the clientSecret is indeed empty as opposed to being obfuscated. (PASS)

status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: App Status URL is not returned in GET response to /channel/v1/settings when called by DT

fields.description:
*User Story*
* As a Channel Admin API user, when I call the Channel Settings API I should only see attributes that are applicable to my marketplace
* As a Channel Admin API user, when I call the Channel Settings API I should only be able to modify attributes applicable to my marketplace 

*Feature*
# When a API client with Channel Admin role calls /api/channel/v1/settings, settings that are dependent on another setting should be returned only if the dependency has been met. For example, only if a SMS Gateway is setup for a marketplace, the "enable SMS notification" channel settings should be returned by the API
# When a API client with Channel Admin role calls /api/channel/v1/settings, partner specific (like DT or Telstra only) settings not applicable to my marketplace settings are not returned.
# API client with CA or SU should not be able to modify a dependent settings unless the dependency has been met.
# API client in the context of a partner should not be able to modify a setting applicable to another partner.

*Acceptance criteria*
* When a API client with Superuser role calls /api/channel/v1/settings/{partner}, all settings pertaining {partner} is returned. This includes all dependent settings

pr_title: PI-6712 add method isPartnerCenterConfigurationComplete to CustomInte…

fields.summary: As a developer, I want to verify Partner Center configuration is complete for a partner

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress

issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
Please update CustomIntegrationConfigurationServiceExtension with a method for verifying that a given partner has completed partner center configuration. Because this is Microsoft specific, the other extensions can throw UnsupportedOperationException. 

h3. Example
Please take CustomIntegrationConfigurationServiceExtension.isConfigurationComplete as example, it is very close to what we want to achieve (only for Partner Center API).

h3. What to consider for configuration complete
Take a look at PartnerCenterServiceImpl.getAuthenticationToken:149, this is where the configuration is consumed. Whatever is used for authentication can be considered for completeness. Here is the list of configuration that is needed:
crestBaseConfiguration.getPartnerCenterAuthHost()
crestBaseConfiguration.getPartnerCenterResource()
crestBaseConfiguration.getPartnerCenterApiHost()
partnerCenterConfiguration.getApplicationDomain()
partnerCenterConfiguration.getClientId()
azureConfig.getManagementUsername()
azureConfig.getManagementPassword()

h3. CompanySyncService
We can put a method at the service to expose this functionality

{code:java}
boolean CompanySyncService.isConfigurationComplete(String partner);
// For now get the extension for CustomIntegration.MOSI, we will tackle the generic way later.
{code}

h3. Test Scenarios (to be updated)
automated with unit tests

The code should be tested by scenarios in PI-6392 which in turn are covered by test scenarios in PI-6400

pr_title: DS-11474 Allow proper jbilling orders cleanup when refund operation has to be rollbacked

fields.summary: As a system, AD should use proper compensation transaction on every attempt to trigger a refund

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
As a channel admin, I want to be able to refund my customer. If a refund fails, any action done by the system should be cancelled / nullified by a proper compensation transaction / changes if required.

Current behavior: in order to proceed with a refund, AD will:
1. create some refund orders
2. create a refund invoice
3. trigger a payment for the refund invoice

If any of these steps fail, the different steps should be cancelled in the following order:
a. delete all refund orders
b. delete the refund invoice
c. delete the failed payment

Step a. is failing due to some bad mapping of data in:
 - https://github.com/AppDirect/AppDirect/blob/master/appdirect-parent/appdirect/src/main/java/com/appdirect/backend/billing/service/BillingServiceImpl.java#L2286-L2294 the billingOrderIds is propagated to the database as it's set 
 - https://github.com/AppDirect/AppDirect/blob/master/appdirect-parent/appdirect/src/main/java/com/appdirect/backend/billing/service/SubscriptionServiceImpl.java#L561-L565 will send a refund on an null billing order id
 - https://github.com/AppDirect/AppDirect/blob/master/appdirect-parent/appdirect/src/main/java/com/appdirect/backend/billing/jbilling/JBillingAPI.java#L1154-L1158 will silently swallow the null billing order id

this has been discovered in DS-10813, where multiple unexpected refund invoices where regenerated by the BillingProcessJob as the refund orders were still active....

pr_title: perf-36: remove role permissions from Channel/ChannelBean and moved out RoleService into its own module

fields.summary: Remove rolePermissions from ChannelBean

comments.body: https://github.com/AppDirect/AppDirect/pull/25502

issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
ChannelBean includes a list of RolePermissions, which leads to a large number of entities loaded when multiple ChannelBeans are constructed. We have methods which build a ChannelBean for each channel in our DB and load all associated role permissions for each channel. In our production environment this results in ~50K rows loaded whenever we build all channels. 

This is a follow up to PERF-34, which addresses the N+1 select issue. While removing N+1 queries will help it's preferable to exclude RolePermissions from the ChannelBean altogether and only load them through a service call as necessary.

pr_title: RM-190 - Package Liquibase, store it in Artifactory.

fields.summary: Package Liquibase, store it in Artifactory, then use the archive to generate the SQL

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress

issuetype.description: A change request to the production environment (access, code release, environment, etc)
issuetype.name: Change Request

fields.description: Instead of checking out the code from Git, it would be much cleaner to use a {{jar}} containing all the necessary Liquibase code. This archive would be deployed to Artifactory, eliminating the need for a Git checkout of the corresponding tag by Release Jenkins. Also, we would no longer need a local Liquibase installation on the dist boxes, eliminating the problems when upgrading Liquibase to a new version.

pr_title: PI-6960 Adding a setting to drive google inbound connector

fields.summary: As a superuser, I should be able to decide if I want to use inbound or outbound google.

issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
1. Create a superuser toggle that determines inbound vs outbound
2. If enabled, the Google Connector should default to the default connector which will send api calls to the microservice.
3. If disabled, the Google Connector should use the existing logic.
4. Setting should be hidden behind the demo flag.


This feature will allow us to keep all the custom UI elements of Google in the monolith while moving the backend to the microservice.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

comments.body: [~edward.sutter]  I saw in some design that some fields are not editable. Do we have a list of non-editable fields?

Just closing the loop on this.  [~cedric.dugas] and I spoke offline I let him know that there aren't any known non-editable fields.  I believe the mocks were originally attempting to show the user's email next the the username.

issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
The step 2 grid works but has some UI issues, this refactor aims at resolving some of them.
Following this [example|http://codepen.io/ajkochanowicz/pen/KHdih]   implement a similar structure.

*Solved:*
Same behavior while scrolling (no column flickering on OSX, as far as I can tell)
Better scrolling bar zones.

*Not solved:*
Forms inside a row still need to still use the form component and stay in divs (we go back to medieval time without it)

*This new grid does not solve:*
Flexible columns width still need to be parsed in JS, I think I can fix the small flickering issue tho.

While its design is a bit better it is not a 100% silver bullet for this use case

[~francois.larochelle], [~silas.nelson]: Did APPDIRECT channel exist on the environment prior to 269? I am trying to ascertain if this issue was introduced in 269 or before.
Decreased priority to critical and removed fix version since this is not new for 269 and they don't need to go into superuser settings at the moment.
-This has been fixed and merged in https://github.com/AppDirect/AppDirect/pull/25246 by removing the Precondition.-  Still investigating ...

The current issue happens when we verify if a DT report supports a partner that is not part of the installation.  This happens because we want to get the list of the supported reports for DT and all the generic one.  Currently, to identify the generic ones, we look at which are supported by `APPDIRECT`.  So there I am identifying two issues:
- Instead of looking for the "APPDIRECT" reports to identify the generic ones, it would be better to have a boolean on the reports to identify the generic ones.
- When calling `ChannelManager.readChannel(String)`, we should consider it can return a `null`. Ideally, we would change the method signature to return an `Optional` and manage it accordingly.  That would be a huge refactoring since there are 1368 calls to channelManager.readChannel(String).

For now, I am proposing the current PR that adds the null check.  
https://github.com/AppDirect/AppDirect/pull/25489

pr_title: RM-191 - Generate a version.txt file

fields.summary: Merge forward - Avoid pom conflicts

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

comments.body: PR: https://github.com/AppDirect/AppDirect/pull/25486

issuetype.description: A change request to the production environment (access, code release, environment, etc)
issuetype.name: Change Request

fields.description:
The merge forward jobs are still failing due to some conflicts over the content of the {{pom.xml}} files, whenever the versions are changed.

The current approach was trying to separate the regular commits from the ones that only changed the version. All the regular commits were merged in one shot, while the version-only commits were either merged using the {{-s ours}} policy or ignored completely.

However, Git merges the cherry picking of commits in a strange way, taking into account the parent commits and still creating conflicts in the {{pom.xml}} files!

There are three options to properly avoid the conflicts:
# store the project versions in some external files and exclude those files from the merge operation. The Maven plugin that does that is not stable though.
# perform a regular merge between the two branches and handle the conflicts programmatically. This is a robust approach... except that once the {{pom.xml}} files have conflict markers, there are no longer valid XML files, making the parsing challenging.
# change the versions in the {{pom.xml}} files before merging the branches to the version from the remote branch, using the Maven {{versions}} plugin. Then, we merge (with {{--no-ff --no-commit}}) and the only conflicts that remain will be actual code conflicts. If the operation works well, we can change the version back to its original value and commit everything.

I personally prefer the last approach as it relies and Maven tools and regular {{git}} operations and can easily be scripted.

comments.body: Ping [~ravnish.gupta], [~eduardo.trzan], [~jean-guy.descure], [~chintan.sanghvi]

[~jessica.barrows]: I looked at the code and it seems like this since the first inception of quotes - that is, quote activities are associated with both a company AND a user "subject" - in this case the company has precedence and the activity is reported as a company one.

This is why the event is reported as a company. 

Now this doesn't seem to be a desirable behavior  - especially since the activity logs as seen on the channel portal for the company obeys a different logic and in this case the actual user is displayed. I don't see why a user can't see who did the actual action (barring the "hide channel user" settings), and it's definitely not in line with other activities made through BOBO or by other members of the company.

I don't think however this deserve a critical nor blocker status as it has been there for months, however I believe this should be converted into a bug.

[~ryan.buick], [~charles-andre.martin]: FYI
Back to [~jessica.barrows] for follow-up

Hi [~jocelyn.lepage],
is it a behavior that differs from the standard one ? If yes it should be definitely reported as a bug critical (not blocker).
Thanks
JG

Thanks for looking into this ticket [~jocelyn.lepage]! I checked the quote flow when a SSR saves a quote for a user and the dashboard activities appear as expected (i.e "<Channel user> created a quote for <application name> for <user quote was created for>.")
Screencast: http://screencast.com/t/Kd60TQyL
Dashboard view: http://screencast.com/t/nNIGitDSc 

As for priority, I'm not sure what priority to set this ticket at since this has been the behavior, as you said, since the first inception of quotes so I don't believe this is new behavior but definitely behavior we could improve. Thoughts? 

In the mean time, I can convert this Q&A to a bug and we can adjust the priority as needed.

Thanks again Jocelyn!
CC [~jean-guy.descure], [~ravnish.gupta]
Downgrading to Major. We can upgrade it Rogers requests a fix.
Thx [~ravnish.gupta] and [~jessica.barrows]!

[~jocelyn.lepage], [~ravnish.gupta], [~jessica.barrows], [~ryan.buick], just to confirm what's the expected behaviour here:

* Users should see the name of the user who triggered the event on the dashboard when they belong to the same company.
* Users should see the name of the channel user who triggered the event on the dashboard only if the setting "Hide channel user names and email addresses from customers" is disabled.
* This change should apply to all marketplaces.

Please, if you could confirm this EB we can start working on it.
Related bug.
Related story.
EB Confirmed, [~andres.sommariva]
PR https://github.com/AppDirect/AppDirect/pull/25465

[~ryan.buick], [~andres.sommariva], [~ignacio.colombo]: I just want to make the EB statement a bit more accurate:

About:
* Users should see the name of the channel user who triggered the event on the dashboard only if the setting "Hide channel user names and email addresses from customers" is disabled.

I don't think the "Hide channel user names" setting influences the fix to be made here. 
What we have here is quotes can be created by either by a customer company, a SSR or a Reseller. 
When a quote is created by a customer company, we want users from that company to see the actual user having created the quote, instead of just the company name. For SSRs and Resellers-created quote, my understanding is that we still continue to see only the company who has created the quote, and not the actual SSR or Reseller (this actual behavior is perhaps to be revisited at some point). 

Let me know what you think!

[~ryan.buick], [~andres.sommariva], [~jocelyn.lepage]: Re-writing the EB based on Jocelyn's comment:

* Users should see the name of the *user* who triggered the event on the dashboard *_when they belong to the same company_*.
* Users should see the *company* name of the SSR or Reseller who triggered the event on the dashboard

What is the EB when a Channel Admin was who triggered the event? Does it depend on the channel setting "Hide channel user names and email addresses from customers"? 
Currently (on production release) on CA activities always uses the Company name independent on the channel setting.

Thanks to all!

[~ignacio.colombo], Channel Admin should always see everything. The channel setting you're referring to only applies to the end customer view. That setting exists so that users don't the personal contact information of a Telco employee.

[~ryan.buick] Yes, I agree with that. My question is about this scenario:

* Users should see the name of the *[company? user?]* when the activity was triggered by a Channel Admin. 

Thanks!

[~jocelyn.lepage], [~andres.sommariva], as we chat with [~ryan.buick]:

* Users should see the *company name* of the Channel Admin who triggered the event on the dashboard.

fields.summary: IBM Performance: /account/v1/companies/*/users/*/products ave. 1900 ms

comments.body: [~hoangha.pham] [~yan.avery] [~marc-antoine.bibeau] FYI

[~pierre-alexandre.lacerte], I think this should be first looked into by the TPM team in charge of IBM, and if it's an actual issue across the board, it can be escalated to the IAM team. That's the standard process around "partner" related issues. 

Make sense? Thanks!
Absolutely. Thanks!

Sample traces in New Relic:
https://rpm.newrelic.com/accounts/1306383/applications/17290784/transactions#id=5b225765625472616e73616374696f6e2f4150492f6163636f756e742f76312f636f6d70616e6965732f2a2f75736572732f2a2f70726f6475637473222c22225d&tab-detail_15d97fb8-a70e-11e6-8137-f8bc12425498_28916_100250=database_queries&app_trace_id=15d97fb8-a70e-11e6-8137-f8bc12425498_28916_100250

We don't seem to have any slow queries but there is a very high number of queries, indicating some N+1 select issues. Some of them could be addressed by adding the @BatchSize annotation, as discussed in PERF-1.
[~fconstantinou] Unfortunately, the N+1 SQL query is due to a a For loop on all the fetched users. @BatchSize will not help us here :( Currently looking on a way to optimize

I see a number of entities which would benefit from using BatchSize. A few examples:
 EditionPricingItem -> ItemPrices
AttributeOption -> AttributeOptionTranslations
EditionPricing -> TerminationFeePrices
Edition -> EditionIncludedUnit

In general, I don't see a reason not to set BatchSize for all collections.
Sure, I'm not saying to not use it, just that current N+1 issue will not be helped by it.
Just saying that there are a lot of N+1 select issues :). Some mighty be trickier to address, that's for sure.

fields.description:
As a dev, I want to be able pull customer accounts from Microsoft Partner Center;

# Update Partner Center Service in the monolith to expose the new functionalities of the client
# Update the Microsoft extension (CompanySyncMicrosoftServiceExtension) for polling data in the scheduler

h3. 1 Update Partner Center Service in the monolith to expose the new functionalities of the client
The PR above added two functionalities to the client;

# Read the customers of a partner with paging
# Get the details of a customer

In the service layer, we just need to expose these functionalities (please take a look at PartnerCenterServiceImpl#isMPNValid as an example)

h3. 2 Update the Microsoft extension (CompanySyncMicrosoftServiceExtension) for polling data in the scheduler

We shouldn't push existing customer accounts. The supports method of the extension can check for CustomIntegration enum.

*SyncMicrosoftServiceExtension polling pseudocode*
{noformat}
X is the number of companies per page
Get  the next X companies
 Check the ones don't exist in the db (one query, persistence extension will have the functionality)
 For each company that don't exist
   Populate a SyncedCompanyWS object
   Get the customer details from Partner Center
   Update the syncedCompanyWS object
   Put the syncedCompanyWS in a list for new customers
Return new customers list
{noformat}

h3. Test Scenarios (automated by com.appdirect.backend.sync.extension.CompanySyncMicrosoftServiceExtensionTest)
h4. Pre-requisites*
Tailoring the test scenarios for manual testing *(orchard box!!!)*, this means that we assume the scheduled job is in place (PI-6628)

h5. Crest configuration 
Crest configuration for a partner, check the company sync epic description. For manual testing, please follow the steps below
# Setup your postman: https://appdirect.jira.com/wiki/display/PI/Accessing+Microsoft+Partner+Center+API+with+Postman.  (This postman collection is using AppDirect config, same as the one from the epic description)
# Use "Get List of Customers", update the size parameter in the URL to -1 to get all customers. Let's say there are 210 companies in total.
# (Only for Scenario 3) From the result, pick 20 companies and find them in `mosi_customer_accounts` by their customer id and delete them *(orchard box only)*
 !Screen Shot 2016-10-19 at 11.27.13 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h5. No previously synced companies (scenario 1-2 only)
{code:java}
select * from `mosi_customer_accounts` where `tenant_origin` = "SYNC";
should return zero results
{code}

h4. Scenario 1 (test method: testPullCompaniesFromISV_givenNoCountryForCustomIntegration_shouldReturnEmptyList)
# Partner does't have country specific crest configuration (country is used by company sync to filter out synced companies)
# Let the sync job run (job will pull companies and push them to the company sync push api) which runs every 15 mins
# Verify no company is synced
This can be verified in the db
{code:java}
select * from `mosi_customer_accounts` where `tenant_origin` = "SYNC";
should return zero results
{code}


h4. Scenario 2 (test method: testPullCompaniesFromISV_givenCountryAndAllNewCompanies_shouldPullAllCompanies)
# Partner has crest configuration specific to Japan, there are 210 new (not previously synced) companies in Partner Center API
# Let the sync job run (job will pull companies and push them to the company sync push api) which runs every 15 mins
# Verify the result list contains 210 records
This can be verified in the db
{code:java}
select * from `mosi_customer_accounts` where `tenant_origin` = "SYNC";
should return 210 results
{code}
# Verify paging worked as expected (first call received )
{code:java}
Check logs for 
Pulled count=210 companies for partner=PARTNER
{code}

h4. Scenario 3 (test method: testPullCompaniesFromISV_givenCountryAndSomeNewCompanies_shouldPullOnlyNewCompanies)
# For manual testing, we will need to write some of the companies for a partner in the db beforehand. This can be done by using postman and get some of their customers and manually persist them in the db.
# Partner has crest configuration specific to USA, there are 1125 companies in total; 190 of them are new (not previously synced) and 20 of them are already synced.
# Pull companies (Pulls 210 of them, filters outs existing ones)
# Verify the result list contains 20 records
{code:java}
select * from `mosi_customer_accounts` where `tenant_origin` = "SYNC"  order by `created_on` DESC;
should see the recently created 20 records at the top
{code}
# Verify paging worked as expected (first call received 210 records)
{code:java}
Check logs for
Pulled count=210 companies for partner=PARTNER
count=20 new companies found for given count=210 pulled companies
{code}

pr_title: AM-3730 assign apps v2 superuser setting

fields.summary: Swap v1 and v2 with a Superuser setting - FINAL Commit

comments.body:
As per our discussion during planning (Nov/18) ...

- New superuser setting should be used for "routing" purposes.
- The v1 page should remain accessible even for partners that are configured for v2, if they know the direct URL to access the v1 page directly. Also needed for the "Integration Report".
- The v2 page should ideally not be accessible for partners that are not configured for v2 (Access Denied), but if that's too complex to implement, the same strategy as the v1 page is also acceptable.

If I can place my 2 cents:
I think we should have 3 paths in order to have maximum flexibility

assign/
assign/v1
assign/v2

since the superuser setting redirect to assign/ or assign/v2 if we want to be able to access v1 anytime we should have a path the specifically show v1 (why the assign/v1)
then assign/ would just become a "landing router"

just using assign/ and assign/v2 would result in forcing using one or the other without the possibility to go on v1 if we are set on v2

What do you guys think [~yan.avery], [~taylor.brennan], [~edward.sutter] ?
[~olivier.rousseau], sounds good to me.

[~olivier.rousseau], I'm not sure how this was implemented, but remember that we must preserve the integration report to go thru /v1 even when /v2 is turned on that for that channel ...

CC: [~alex.malyovanny]

Agree with [~olivier.rousseau]. Currently the routing takes place on /assign page, so there is no way to get back to V1. We would have to either add some URL parameter to ignore the routing or create an /assign/V1 that would add that parameter and then forward to /assign page.

This would all be done in Wicket (backend)

Ok, so the approach will be to change the current assign apps page from {{/account/assign}} to {{/account/assign/v1}}. Then a new wicket page will be created with the mount path {{/account/assign}} that will redirect to either v1 or v2 based on the channel setting. Is this correct? Is there a better way to implement it?

Current page should not change. We just change the routing mechanism to handle some "ignoreRouting" parameter and then add an extra page "account/assign/V1" that will add that parameter and forward to "account/assign"

Isn't a bit confusing that way [~alex.malyovanny] ?
"account/assign" can serve v1 or redirect to v2 depending and if "account/assign/v1" was hit previously ?

* Edit *
Oh! just saw [~yan.avery]'s comment regarding integration report. I see that we might not have the choice but to keep "assign" to be v1 and "assign/v1" to be the proxy.

[~olivier.rousseau].
I think it's actually pretty straightforward
account/assign/V1 - explicit path to V1
account/assigg/V2 - explicit path to V2
account/assign  - goes to whatever version is specified in Superuser
I thought you were saying something else, would the integration report work after a redirection to /v1 then?

[~olivier.rousseau]
 Currently, Integration Report will always go to V1 assignment, regardless of the Superuser settings. This behavior is currently coded into the router itself and will remain there until V2 assignment screens will be made to work properly with Integration Report.
Perfect, it all works then.
https://github.com/AppDirect/AppDirect/pull/25443

fields.summary: TAM | SAASE-65 | O2A | Customer who had an invoice that was marked as invalid account, gets suspended after 14 days and then updates Billing Details with new TBill has services still in suspened state.

comments.body:
[~gaurav.bhatnagar] has questions around the implementation to [~peter.park]

This ticket is to identify the solution.


CC  - [~prakash.vippa] [~raymond.leung]

Hey [~peter.park],

I think right now we check if the order have any unpaid invoice then do not activate the order.
To fix this issue we can have one more restriction to check if order have those invoice as unpaid that is not been transmitted yet.
We can identified this by invoice_lines error status = null.

What do you think ?

Yes, I think if we do a check for invoice_line.error_status is either null or TBILL_CHARGE_TRANSMITTED it will cover this scenario. In other words, invoices which have not been transmitted yet, or have not been received back from TBill, will not affect un-suspension of the order.

[~praveen.kumar] -  Please validate the response from [~peter.park] and post any questions you may have on projected scope and development.

CC - [~gaurav.bhatnagar] [~raymond.leung] [~prakash.vippa]

[~raymond.leung] I have created PR 
https://github.com/AppDirect/AppDirect/pull/25437 .

I am checking all possible scenario to test my changes.

[~raymond.leung] [~gaurav.bhatnagar]

I have question as I was checking data.

- In InvoiceLine we have different type of row. Some time we have different different ErrorStatus for each line. For which type of Line should I check restriction.
[~praveen.kumar], just 'ITEM' type

fields.description:
Description:

Customer who had an invoice that was marked as "invalid account", gets suspended after 14 days and then updates Billing Details with new TBill has services still in suspened state. where after updating with valid T-bill service should be in active status.

Test data:
User Name: tamuser100+300@gmail.com
Password: PSLword1
Role: Customer Admin

URL: https://test.marketplace.telstra.com

Browser used: IE\Chrome

Screenshots: Yes

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Log in to the marketplace as Customer admin user
2. Go to Manage ->Billing-> Register for T-Bill
3. Purchase Canavs product
4. Go to Account -> Apllication --> Product Should be available under Application Tab
5. After Month End Bill Run, Invoice is rejected by Robot.
6.After 14 days, Update Billing method with new Valid T-Bill.
6.Verify product should be in active state after updating valid new T-Bill

Expected Result:

Product should be in active status after updating with new valid T-bill after 14 days.

Actual Result:

Customer who had an invoice that was marked as "invalid account", gets suspended after 14 days and then updates Billing Details with new TBill has services still in suspened state. where after updating with valid T-bill service should be in active status.

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
*Preconditions:*
# Company purchased a single MSFT app (Exchange Online Plan 1) with say: 5 seats
# Superuser > MOSI > Enable Graph Sync v2 = true
# End users are created on MOP with assigned licenses
# Users are not synced (Usersync tab is empty)

*Channel: Appdirect*

User: appdirect2of269@yopmail.com
Password: test1234

*Steps to Reproduce:*
1) Login as company Admin. Navigate to Account > Manage apps > Msft app > UserSync tab
2) Observe that Non user friendly message "No.synced.user" is displayed, which is incorrect.

*Actual Result:*
Non user friendly message "No.synced.user" is displayed under Manage App> Msft app> "UserSync" tab when there are no users to display

*Expected Result:*
{color:#14892c}User friendly message like "No results to display" or "No synced users" should be displayed under Manage App> Msft app> "UserSync" tab when there are no users to display{color}

*Reproducibility:*
{Always}

pr_title: APPD-53 Channel Admin Pending Product Version Alert

fields.summary: Channel Admin sees warning themed alert about pending product versions on the product versions list and product dashboard pages

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress

components.name: UI Screens
components.description: Permanent UI Screens hosted as part of Core

comments.body: Looks good to me.

issuetype.description: A user story. Created by JIRA Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.description:
As an OEM Admin, I can see a "Warning" themed Alert Component on the product dashboard, as well as the product versions list page so that I know what platforms on a product have product versions pending so I can review them and publish the product to marketplace. This components contents should be: * "This product has _n_ product versions pending your launch approval. You must approve or deny these versions in the following platforms: _PlatformA_ _PlatformB_ ...” ** _n_ represents the number of pending approval product versions the product has ** _PlatformA_, _PlatformB_, etc. indicate platforms associated with the product that have pending approval product versions. Each one links to the “Product Versions” list page for that platform. When arriving at the "Product Versions" list page via the Alert link the *table’s filters are open* and ONLY the “Pending approval” filter is enabled which shows only the product versions that have “Pending Approval” as a state Additionally, the 'Publish' button should be disabled if there are any product versions in the pending approval state. * The “Publish” buttons are disabled if a product has product versions in a pending approval state ** Disabled “Publish” buttons have a tool-tip with the following copy, “To publish this product you must review the product versions in all platforms.
There are _n_ product versions pending approval.” *** _n_ represents the number of pending approval product versions [Prototype link|http://rubicon-core-dev.base2.appdirect.com/prototype/appcarousel/oemadmin/product_versions.html]

fields.summary: External product profile preview for Universal Marketplace

attachment.filename: Where the preview button is in AD.pdf

comments.body: To be discussed in 9/14 call.

Please maintain within this request the ability for Channel Admin and Developers to initiate & perform simulated test purchases/orders/events. This ability can be provided in a different way, however, we do not want to lose the ability for integrated flows to be tested/exercised in real time.

This is a contender for #1 spot in IBM Q4 2016 priorities.

The proposed mechanism, although not detailed at this point, would probably be a simple link override on the AD product profile edition form preview button opening an IBM-served page which would render the currently edited product in UM format. 

Ideally, the link would contain the product identifier and the UM preview page would leverage the existing AD APIs to retrieve the information in a manner identical or nearly-identical to currently used "get product detail" calls.

This preview page, or an intermediate page on IBM's side, would be responsible for displaying any validation problem with the data, for instance a field containing too many characters for the UM but being accepted by the AD validation rules.

Action on IBM
- Document diverging requirements between current AD field validation and desired UM field validation: which fields, what is the delta in terms of data (char count, img dimensions, file size) as well as delta in labeling/wording.

Action on AD
- Verify that unpublished data is available through API
- Validate what would be the impact of a UM preview replacing the current preview from a "checkout workflow validation through preview" standpoint

Joint action items:
- Detail technical approach

Stretch goals for AD, not part of Q4 target deliverable:
- Explore the possibility of toggling the Publish profile button active/inactive state based on a return value obtained from the preview mechanism on the IBM side.
- Explore impacts and side effects of this idea on publishing workflows in general.

*Q: Can we get unpublished data through the same product API that IBM uses?*
A: Yes, the product API will return data for unpublished products as well  - this was tested successfully on stage marketplace. 

*Q: Is preview the same as integration test? Is it transaction_mode = test?*
A: It's not technically the same, but it will also create purchase orders and everything in DB with transaction_mode = test but it's main purpose is for the developer to validate that the UI is correct, not validate the purchase flow or the integration endpoints

* Checkout workflow validation through product preview is convenient but does not contribute to integration test completion.
* Checkout workflow validation through integration test is the preferred way, separate from product preview feature, and contributes to product profile completion (100%).

Therefore losing checkout workflow access from preview by using an external UM preview is a blessing in disguise, no functionality is lost but the proper workflow will now be the single path to checkout validation.

Guillaume

I don't believe we will be able to model the checkout flow.  Would it be possible for a branch point that would allow either the custom review of the PDP or the built in preview flow that would happen today?  We could even put that on our page if we could launch back to your Preview link, but I fear that might be restricted so that we could not launch it.

Please consider this to see if you see options that we can finalize moving forward.

Thanks.  RR

[~randy.rendahl] can you expand on what usage you make currently of the checkout flow through the preview?

The only use I can see for that is to validate integration endpoints, which should be done from the integration report testing functionality anyway.
[~hoangha.pham] do you see any reason why we couldn't have 2 buttons? One for our preview, one for IBM's UM preview?

It would appear that checkout through preview is useful in cases like IBM-1370.

[~randy.rendahl] i believe then a 2 button approach is advisable.

The test checkout flow is used for add-ons. I believe we have also used it in allowing our business support team to check interactive end-point functions, and for both business support & developers to validate the order/billing unit of measures & texts associated with pricing edition config.

Guillaume

As I think about the IBM preview side of this, one capability that is widely liked in the AppDirect preview comes to mind as an area I would like to be able to recreate in at least some limited fashion.

The feature I refer to is the ability to link directly back to the edit point for a particular update.  For instance if they don't have a logo, there might be a place the logo would be that is a link to the Listing Info.

As we finalize this design, I would be very interested in seeing if we can retain that capability within the scope we're considering.

FYI budgeted time is:

- 2d tech design
- 4d development
- 1d qa

Hi guys,

I'm working on the tech design for this ticket.
This is the link where the page is: https://appdirect.jira.com/wiki/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=173768891
I will be continue working on this documentation.

{quote}

SPECIFICATIONS - APPDIRECT'S RESPONSIBILITIES
Consult IBM for detailed technical design.
Add a second preview button (UM Preview) in Product Profile Edition form; which opens IBM external page in a new tab and passes it product id.
Validate and document product API call that returns current but unpublished product data.

{quote}

* Tech design should describe how we will pass the product id to be previewed (url, querystring, key, format of value).
* Tech design should describe how IBM will use this value to call our API and retrieve the product profile data. This should be identical to existing get product profile info call that [~mauricio.pereyra] documented when we received detailed API usage description from Colleen last quarter. Validate there is no difference in this scenario and document delta if there is any.

What IBM is looking for is "how will this connect with our system, what do we need to expect".
Tech Design submitted for approval & review at https://appdirect.jira.com/wiki/display/IBM/IBM-1404+-+External+product+profile+preview+for+Universal+Marketplace+%28Technical+Design%29+V2

[~edgardo.cheble] can you make the button not show up at all when no URL is configured instead of being greyed out?

That way we could merge and ship this even if IBM isn't ready as the config would double up as a feature toggle.

Otherwise the button would show up as greyed out until IBM has finished implementing the preview on their side. :/
[~guillaume.roy] done. Pull request has been updated addressing your latest comment. Also IBM-1513 Acceptance Criteria has been updated accordingly

ATTN [~edgardo.cheble] CC [~hoangha.pham]

{quote}
Working with the team, this is the desired wording for the button:

"Preview in IBM Marketplace"

To control space the text could be stacked and buttons center aligned, etc as needed.

Also, Joe went through the Developer panels and highlighted a number of places that appear to be affected (more than the two buttons shown in the design doc).  Please take a look at the attached document and make sure they're all addressed or help us understand where there is not a reason to address.
{quote}

(see PDF attached)

Guillaume

One question in the doc was the style of call.  Feedback from the team indicated the URL approach would be preferred.

Also, would it be possible to also have a query parameter that indicates the user launching the preview?  I think we can reverse engineer it from the Blue ID signon token, but I'm hoping that it can be provided on the call.  The reasoning for wanting it is to allow access control on the previewable content since it will be populated into a common presentation service.

Thanks.  RR

[~hoangha.pham] [~guillaume.roy] regarding the above comment... do you know which user id we should use to send that as a query param to them? Should it be the UUID? 
Also... is it safe to send them that on a query parameter?

[~randy.rendahl], which user id would you require? Would sending the appdirect user UUID be sufficient? Or do you need the IBM id, which is only available for users on the sub marketplaces. 

Also, there might be a security concern in passing the user UUID as a query param.

This will only be used in the parent marketplace, so it needs to be something in that environment (not IBM ID).  Is UUID the value that I would use to query AD for additional attributes about the user such as e-mail etc?  Is there any alternate value that allows the same without a security concern?

Additional question:

Since we're using the products API for this, how are we assuring that we get the development version, not a previously published version?

If it's a different ID due to the development version (just guessing), will I be able to use that ID to point back to developer content for the product?  For instance can I point at:

https://marketplace.ibmcloud.com/cms/editApp/<Prod ID>?#support

using that ID (like I can cut and paste from a developer view of editing a product into a different browser to look at the support section of a product)?

Let me know if I simply forgot or overlooked how this Published v Development version is differentiated.

Thanks.  RR
assigning to [~perry.wong] as he is taking over this feature

[~hoangha.pham] [~perry.wong] can you chime in on [~randy.rendahl]'s questions?

#1 The UUID would be a stretch goal as it is not part of the original SOW reqs, but if it is *safe* and *simple* to do let's go for it. [~hoangha.pham] who could validate the security implications?

#2 I guess this would depend on how we build the route for product profile... probably [~perry.wong] can answer this.

ATTN [~randy.rendahl];

After discussion with our Product team, the only location in the developer portal where we can insert an additional button for the IBM Preview is the top right button row in the product profile edition form (see screencap).

Unfortunately adding buttons to the left side nav or other pages in the developer portal would clash with some of our internal guidelines.

Responsibility for any confusion in that regard lies with me, my apologies.

 !Screen Shot 2016-11-22 at 2.15.56 PM.png|thumbnail!

[~perry.wong] [~hoangha.pham]

I see 2 PRs for this:
* https://github.com/AppDirect/AppDirect/pull/25392 (Mauricio)
* https://github.com/AppDirect/AppDirect/pull/24975 (Edgardo)

I believe the second one is deprecated? Just to be sure.

Also [~perry.wong], what is the release ETA for this?

Hi [~guillaume.roy],

That's right, the latest PR is https://github.com/AppDirect/AppDirect/pull/25392 (mine). I did the changes asked on Edgardo's PR. I will let the reviewer that the changes are addressed on this one.
Perry is not involved on this anymore, Mauricio is the owner of this.

fields.summary: [External product profile preview] - Add an extra 'Preview on IBM' button to IBM's edit application page (CMS)

fields.description:
As a partner developing products for the IBM marketplace, I need to be able to see how my product will look and behave in the actual IBM marketplace.  The current preview in the IBM AppDirect instance displays a preview consistent with the AppDirect storefront, but does not provide any sense of the IBM Marketplace experience.  Additionally, I don't want to publish my product without this review, but currently my only recourse is to publish and review.

In that context the following request is intended to provide this capability.

The request is twofold:
1)  Enable a Preview button that can drive an external endpoint where IBM can maintain code designed to interpret the product data of the product under development and present it in the IBM Marketplace design.  As part of the call enough information would need to flow to know the user requesting the preview and the product under development at a minimum.
2)  Provide access to the product data of the product under development.  Optimally this would be returned in the same format as the current listing and product APIs.  In this manner, the same code used to harvest the production catalog would be used to gather and process development content (perhaps with a unique API endpoint or other aspects to differentiate production from development).

Additional collaboration is welcome if there are alternative approaches that provide the flexibility of IBM managing a continuously changing storefront look and feel and the ability to provide a real time preview in the context of the offering development/definition experience.

{panel:title=SOW}
DELIVERABLES
The IBM Universal Marketplace storefront has a different look than the AppDirect marketplace storefront. In order to facilitate onboarding on the UM, the deliverable for this SOW is a second preview button leading to a UM-styled preview.

SPECIFICATIONS - APPDIRECT'S RESPONSIBILITIES
Consult IBM for detailed technical design.
Add a second preview button (UM Preview) in Product Profile Edition form; which opens IBM external page in a new tab and passes it product id.
Validate and document product API call that returns current but unpublished product data.

SPECIFICATIONS - IBM'S RESPONSIBILITIES
Discuss detailed technical design with AppDirect.
Implement an externally-hosted page taking as a parameter a product id.
Retrieve data from AppDirect API for corresponding product id.
Render UM-styled product page preview.
Display appropriate data validation messages.
{panel}
